intro: Sarcanthus auriculatus, commonly known as the ear-shaped spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ear-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in drought-tolerant gardens.
